item.title: Introduction
item.description: Kafka Streams Introduction Run Demo App Tutorial: Write App Concepts Architecture Developer Guide Upgrade The easiest way to write mission-critical real-time applications and microservices Kafka Streams is a client library for building applications and microservices, where the input and output data are stored in Kafka clusters. It combines the simplicity of writing and deploying standard Java and Scala applications on the client side with the benefits of Kafka’s server-side cluster technology.

item.title: Core Concepts
item.description: Core Concepts Introduction Run Demo App Tutorial: Write App Concepts Architecture Developer Guide Upgrade Kafka Streams is a client library for processing and analyzing data stored in Kafka. It builds upon important stream processing concepts such as properly distinguishing between event time and processing time, windowing support, and simple yet efficient management and real-time querying of application state. Kafka Streams has a low barrier to entry : You can quickly write and run a small-scale proof-of-concept on a single machine; and you only need to run additional instances of your application on multiple machines to scale up to high-volume production workloads.
